tpsa 0.1.0

    • Testing Polygons Spatial Association

Polygons Spatial Association Test

psat_mc_top.Rd

A Monte Carlo test to verify if two sets of polygons are associated. The difference bewtween this function and the function psat_mc is that here you can choose the test statistic.

psat_mc_top(obj_sp1, obj_sp2, n_sim = 500L, unique_bbox = NULL,
  alpha = 0.01, ts = "psam", alternative = "two_sided",
  correction = "none", fixed = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

obj_sp1

an object from class SpatialPolygons or SpatialPointsDataFrame
obj_sp2

an object from class SpatialPolygons or SpatialPointsDataFrame
n_sim

an integer corresponding to the number of Monte Carlo simulations for the test
unique_bbox

a matrix \(2 \times 2\) corresponding to the boundary box that contains the both sets
alpha

a numeric indicating the confidence level
ts

a character indicating the test statistic used in the test, the options are c('psam', 'pk_dist12', 'pk_area12', 'pf12').
alternative

a character indicating the alternative hypothesis, it can be: "two_sided", "repulsion", or "attraction" if you interest is only check if the sets are independent or not, if the two sets repulses each other, or if the two sets attracts each other, respectively.
correction

a character giving the edge correction to be used. Possible entries are c('none', 'torus', 'guard', 'adjust').
fixed

a boolean indicating if the first pattern should be fixed on the toroidal shift or the first will be fixed in half of iterations and then the other one. TRUE or FALSE, respectively.
...

parameters for test statistics functions
same_bbox

a boolean - (desnecessario)
bbox_1

a matrix \(2 \times 2\) corresponding to the boundary box of the first spatial object
bbox_2

a matrix \(2 \times 2\) corresponding to the boundary box of the second spatial object

Value

a list from class psa_test, with values:

p_value

a numeric scalar giving the p-value of the test

sample_ts

a numeric scalar giving the test statistic calculated in the original sample

mc_ts

a numeric vector giving the test statistic for each of the Monte Carlo simulations

alternative

a character giving the alternative hypothesis

alpha

a numeric scalar giving the significance level used on the test

rejects

a logical scalar, TRUE if the null hypothesis is reject

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
